CLUE: International sign of distress at sea
OUTPUT: ['Mayday - An urgent signal used in maritime communication to indicate a life-threatening emergency.', 'SOS - A Morse code sequence (···——···) indicating an emergency, often synonymous with "Mayday".', 'Flares - Brightly burning pyrotechnics used for signaling distress to nearby ships or rescue services.', 'Emergency Position Indicating Radio Beacon (EPIRB) - A device activated upon impact that transmits a distress signal.', 'Man-overboard pole - An extended rod thrown from a ship to indicate a person has fallen overboard in distress.', 'DSC (Digital Selective Calling) - A digital communication protocol used for sending automated emergency messages.', 'Pan-pan - A call sign indicating urgent but not immediately life-threatening situations at sea, often a precursor to "Mayday".', 'Global Maritime Distress and Safety System (GMDSS) - An international maritime safety system that uses various communication technologies for emergency alerts.', 'Alidade - A device used on ships for sighting distant objects or landmarks during navigation, which may also signal distress if misused.', 'Blinker (or Morse light) - An internationally recognized visual signal using flashes to indicate emergency at sea.', 'EPIRB (Emergency Position Indicating Radio Beacon) - A satellite-based search and rescue transponder.', 'HF/MF/VHF radio communication - Standard radio frequencies used for calling in distress or relaying emergency messages at sea.', 'Capsized flag (or upside down flag) - An internationally recognized symbol indicating that a ship is sinking and in need of assistance.', 'International Code of Signals - A system of signals historically used for communication at sea, including emergency signals.', 'PLB (Personal Locator Beacon) - A portable satellite messaging device designed to transmit the location of individuals in distress or imminent danger.', 'SOS flag signal - An internationally recognized visual sign for distress using a black and white Morse code pattern on flags.', 'Rendezvous point (R/P) - A predetermined location used to meet with rescue units in an emergency at sea.', 'GMDSS (Global Maritime Distress and Safety System) - An internationally agreed-upraniary system that ensures accurate, rapid dissemination of distress alerts from ships or aircraft.', 'NAVTEX (Navigational Telex) - A global satellite service for the delivery of navigational and meteorological information as well as safety warnings to ships.', "Mayday call - An internationally recognized voice signal used by mariners in an emergency at sea, typically repeated three times followed by essential details like ship's name, position, nature of distress, and intentions."]
